Context:
* The text is about goals for the new year and resources provided by George Brown College (GBC) to help students reach their goals.
* TLC at GBC offers one-on-one tutoring and workshops for English and math skills improvement.
* Students are encouraged to find study buddies and start a study group.
* Orientation events are happening from January 4 onward for new and returning students to meet new people and learn about life at GBC.
* New students can register for academic program orientation sessions.
* BSSN community can be joined on Instagram (@bssn_gbc) for Black community members and allies.
* Students can join one of the clubs at George Brown or start their own.
* Hundreds of scholarships, bursaries, and awards are offered by GBC, with a deadline to apply for winter-semester awards on February 7, 2024.
* Students are encouraged to make a budget and stick to it and can sign up for a free Financial Literacy Workshop.
* George Brown participates in the HigherEd Points program, where friends and family can donate Aeroplan points to help students pay for their education.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/New year's resolution tips for students | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* George Brown College has careers positions available for students and alumni on their website, GBCareers.
* Students can connect with Career Services advisors for help with resumes and interview skills.
* On-demand fitness classes are available at the college.
* Resources are available to help students quit smoking or vaping, including the Smokers Helpline (1-877-513-5333) and tips from the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH).
* The Student Association's Student Nutrition Access Program (SNAP) offers resources and support for students who cannot afford healthy foods.
* All full-time students have free access to LinkedIn Learning, which has thousands of online courses on various topics.
* Virtual work-integrated learning opportunities are available across Canada and around the world.
* George Brown College participates in the Riipen Level Up program.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/New year's resolution tips for students | George Brown College.txt

Context: The text mentions that the college participates in the Riipen Level Up program which pairs students with employers for paid projects. This program provides an opportunity for students to gain experience and add to their resume. Additionally, the college offers information about international work and study opportunities. The contact details provided are 416-415-2000 for regular queries and 1-877-515-5559 for TTY, with the email address ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college has a social media hub for visitors to explore. The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice and students are responsible for verifying their fee requirements.
